title: /etc/hosts is still reset after every restart (i.e. custom entries do not persist)
body: Despite the "fixed" status on the other post asking the same question, the /etc/hosts file is STILL reset every time bash restarts.  To reproduce:

comments.body: Ok, I don't know if this slipped in with some recent build or if I've just been missing it this whole time.  There's a comment line at the top of /etc/hosts that reads:

This is a classic example of a config detail that should be unified between the Windows and WSL environments.  Since the underlying kernel and running system image is one machine (not a VM), it would be good if "hosts" info is in ONE place - probably %SystemRoot%\System32\drivers\etc\hosts, and then the underlying WSL system make the "/etc/hosts" item a virtual read of the Windows file.
